lead_paragraph: ASIA INDONESIA: BORNEO DECLARED UNDER CONTROL After a brief tour of the Indonesian section of Borneo, where ethnic violence has claimed the lives of at least 460 people since Feb. 18, Vice President Megawati Sukarnoputri, left, said the situation was under control and there was no need to declare a state of emergency. The government has come under sharp criticism for its slow response to the fighting in Kalimantan, where members of the indigenous Dayak ethnic group killed hundreds of Madurese migrants. Calvin Sims (NYT)
